basics.name: Richard H. Moore Jr.
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary:
Over 25 years of software engineering experience. Achieved the following:
  • Worked as a full-stack web developer using ASP.NET (C#/VB.NET WebForms & MVC), PHP, and Perl.
  • Worked with MSSQL, MySQL, and other databases. Also used Code-First technology (EntityFramework, Telerik ORM) with some projects.
  • Past projects also include microservices, multi-threading, multi-platform, hardware integration (IoT), and third-party integration ranging from web services to direct software module installation.
  • Worked in different industries such as the financial (credit card processing), employee benefits, logistics (shipping), and defense industries.
  • Held top secret and secret clearances with the government.
  • Acted in other capacities when needed, such as business analyst, architect, tester, and dev ops engineer.
  • Successfully worked with remote teams and globally distributed team members.
  • Experienced with many development methodologies such as Waterfall, Scrum, and Kanban.
  • Used different agile methods such as Continuous Integration (CI), Test Driven Development (TDD), and Pair Programming.
  • Established DevOps tools and processes within companies.
  • Trained and mentored teams in DevOps tools and processes as well as Scrum methodology.
  • Masters in Business Administration (MBA), Certified Scrum Master (CSM), and Certified Scrum Developer (CSD)

highlights: Automated processing over 1200 Covid-19 PDF waivers for Escondido Soccer Club. This is a C# application reading PDF waivers, sorting them based on type and language, and organizing them based on language and team.
Creating Chrome Extension using CSS and Javascript customizing Haynes online manuals.
Creating Chrome Extension using CSS and Javascript customizing Amazon book pages integrating Goodreads.com (in process).
Volunteering with USDR helping develop web applications for cities supporting their needs during the Covid-19 pandemic.
Architected and developed microservices for processing financial transactions for company customers.

Developed a scheduler service pulling data from SQL Server to feed a Quartz scheduling system. This is a multi-threaded, WCF service. The jobs for the scheduler are maintained within a table in a database. This process enables users to manage jobs without starting/stopping the scheduler. Jobs use Reflection and are dynamically loaded allowing the creation of new jobs without the need to update the scheduler service.
Built WCF Web Services supporting various credit card processor needs.

Built a settlement processor for Barclaycard. Processor builds a settlement file, sends it to Barclaycard via SSL FTP, pulls response files via SSL FTP, and parses and processes the data from the response files. Each one of these tasks is an independent job run by the scheduler which is a multi-threaded environment.
Developed Continuous Integration and Packaging services using Jenkins and NuGet for EMV project.
Converted .Net Framework projects to .Net Core.
work.summary: The company produces “smart” parking meters (IoT). Worked on session and transaction services backend logic. The work entailed adding new credit card processors, supporting third-party development teams, as well as any other payment processing functions such as EMV support. All development is using C#.Net and MSSQL.

highlights: Scoped the database engineer role and documented the database infrastructure for the next company taking over the contract.
Successfully managed difficult personnel.
work.summary: Serco is a defense contractor managing the TORIS contract. The TORIS contract facilitated training of Navy personnel.

highlights: Upon my arrival, team went from consistantly failing to meet sprint contracts to consistantly meeting contract every sprint.
Singled out by team and management for team's success. Managment wanted to move me to a failing team, but team fought move unbeknownst by me.
Lead and architected new third-party integration with company's application.
work.summary: Developed new and existing web based solutions for company's web based application usint ASP.NET and ASP with a MSSQL databse.

highlights: Besides development work, I was further utilized by management to help establish DevOps and other processes based on my past experiences.
work.summary: Segmented sections of JMPS program and converted segments from classic ASP written in VB6 to C# ASP.NET. Converted commercial software to support both 32 and 64 bit platforms. Instituted DevOps placing all software under CMS and customizing workflows within Jira for different projects.

highlights: Wrote proposal for new framework

New framework would be fully automated first running unit tests, then deploy to virtual envirments for testing, then packaged. Any issues will generate Jira tickets. Proccess will be self-documenting.
work.summary: Helped architect and estimate a new continuous integration and deployment framework. New framework would be fullly automated, testing and documenting the process. Defined and developed data warehouse importing data from TeamCity.
work.position: Senior Software Engineer/Enterprise Continuous Integration Engineer (contract)

highlights: Implemented DevOps and new processes for scoping and developing work within the company.
Lead the hiring of technical consultants and employees.
Implemented Confluence so company can start documenting processes work experience.
work.summary: Develop and maintained new and existing solutions within company's web application supporting shipping logistics for shipping companies. Architected and developed new web-based solutions for existing customers.

highlights: Successfully completed Architecting Enterprise Solutions class.
Successfully completed the Enterprise Architecture Application Training class.
Successfully completed the IT Security – White Hat Training class.
Developed training courses for JMPS build and Scrum.
Helped implement software (OPNET) to measure JMPS performance.
work.summary: Developed new and maintained existing software within the JMPS program using C#, VB, and C++. Fixed the build process allowing nightly builds and monthly releases. Led training seminar for third-party engineers on how to build and deploy the JMPS application. Automated Jenkins setup by pulling content from a CMS, parsing the project files, and then updating and running Jenkin's projects. Co-authored two proposals for the government.

highlights: The company was brand new with only two people in the company.
work.summary: Architected new database and transferred genetic research material into the database. Worked closely with a business consultant defining operation processes and the effort needed to automate them.

highlights: Updated database design implement third normal form.
Helped bring in and oversaw a graphics designer offering a better visual interface for the Marines.
work.summary: Designed and developed a web application for deployed Marines offering detailed instructional checklists. The application also provided an inventory status helping the Marines identify their capabability status.
